#HUMANS_OF_BACH_KHOA_DORMITORY
(Vietnamese caption below)
---
"I used to work in construction. Then I changed my line of work to being a security guard for Bach Khoa Dormitory about 3 years ago."
"Do you know any martial arts?"
"No, I don't" *smile*
"How about your working shift?"
"A two-man shift is 12 hours long, from 6 am to 6 pm and vice versa. Each person gets a 3-hour sleep at night."
"What about Tet Holiday?"
"Tet and other holidays are the same, there are no off days. Exceptionally, on the 1st, 2nd, 3rd day of Tet, we receive a bonus, equal to one working day."
"What is the most memorable memory since you took this job?"
"There is nothing special! Sometimes the students cross over the wall to get into the dorm, I kick their asses out without reporting to the Dorm authorities. I don't want them to be disciplined, poor them!"
"A few months back, there was a big theft case in which many laptops were stolen. I wondered if there were any penalties for the security team."
"The Dorm authorities gave the case full-time attention but could not find any perpetrators. The guard working that shift got a big pay cut that month. As you know, the salary of a security guard is not much..." *sigh*
